page.title: 08LANDSCAPE WOLSTANTON.
page.content: We interviewed some children from Ellison Jr School,who organised the clean up of Morris Square,the shopping precint in the High Street.It was always untidy and full of rubbish.On the wall was a big metal Phoenix,which was corroded and the paint had come off.Richard Holland and David Spence got the idea first,and all the other children agreed.So class 1E wrote to TheNorth Staffs. News and a reporter came and took their story and their photograph.Afew days later it was on the front page of the paper.Then new bins arrived instead of the old ones which had holes in.Quite a lot later a new Phoenix was put up.So their campaign had worked.
